medical_history.chief_complaint: Poor appetite and failure to thrive
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began at 2 months of age with pallor, dyspnea, and tachycardia with periodic gallop rhythm. The patient's cardiovascular function continued to worsen, leading to readmission at 10 months of age for decompensated heart failure.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Deficiency in respiratory-chain complexes I and IV; severe dilated cardiomyopathy; lactic acidosis.
medical_history.family_history: 1 brother who died suddenly at the age of 3 months (no autopsy performed); no other family members with signs of metabolic disease.
